Robotic Platform Compound List

Here are the classes, structs, unions and interfaces with brief descriptions:
  • BarrettArmModel (Kinematics, dynamics, and other model functions of the Barrett Arm. The term "Barrett Arm" refers to the Whole Arm Manipulator without the wrist attached (First four links only))
  • Client (Message passing client)
  • ColumnVector (The class ColumnVector represents column vectors)
  • ControlProgram (The ControlProgram class library is the base class for all QMotor control programs)
  • DefaultGripper (Specific implementation of the Gripper class, with the assumtpion that the Gripper is controlled by two digital lines)
  • DefaultManipulator (Base class for open-architecture manipulators)
  • DefaultOnOffTool (Specific implementation of the OnOffTool class, with the assumtpion that the OnOffTool is controlled by one digital channel)
  • DefaultToolChanger (Specific implementation of the ToolChanger class, with the assumtpion that the ToolChanger is controlled by two digital lines)
  • DefaultTrajectoryGenerator (Creates a trajectory along queued target points)
  • Differentiator (The class Differentiator provides numerical method for differentation)
  • FunctionalObject (The base class of all functional robotic classes)
  • Gripper (Base Class for Grippers)
  • HighpassFilter (High-pass second order butterworth filter)
  • Integrator (The class Integrator uses the trapeziodal rule as a numerical method for integration by default)
  • IOBoardClient (Hardware independent functions to interact with the IOBoardServer to allow access to components located on the I/O board)
  • LowpassFilter (The class LowpassFilter implements the template Filtering class)
  • Manipulator (Base Class for Manipulators)
  • ManipulatorModel (Generic interface for kinematics, dynamics, and other manipulator model functions)
  • MathException (The class MathException provides methods for handling run-time errors and exceptions in mathematical operations that use the functions of the matrix library)
  • Matrix (The class Matrix provides methods for mathematical operations on matrices)
  • MatrixBase (This is a pure virtual base class for Matrix)
  • MotionRequest (Internal class that implements a motion request)
  • ObjectManager (Manages all robotic objects created)
  • ObjectMessageDialog (An object message dialog)
  • OnOffTool (Base Class for OnOffTools)
  • OpenArchitectureManipulator (A base class for Open Architecture Manipulator)
  • PhysicalObject (The base class of all physical robotic classes)
  • Puma560 (Class for Puma 560 robots)
  • Puma560Model (Kinematics, dynamics, and other model functions of the Puma 560 robot)
  • QueueTrajectoryGenerator (Creates a trajectory along queued target points)
  • RoboticObject (The base class of all robotic classes)
  • RoboticPlatform (Overall management of Robotic Platform programs)
  • RoboticPlatformWindow (Base class for all Robotic Platform windows)
  • RowVector (The class RowVector represents row vectors)
  • Server (Message passing server)
  • SliderTrajectoryGenerator (GUI-based trajectory generation from sliders)
  • StaticObject (For displaying static objects in the 3D scene)
  • Status (Allows to stack error codes and status messages)
  • ToolChanger (Base Class for ToolChangers)
  • TrajectoryGenerator (Base class for trajectory generator classes)
  • Transform (The class Transform represents a 4x4 transformation matrix)
  • TypeInfo (Stores run-time type information (base class))
  • TypeInfoAbstractT (Stores run-time type information (template class for abstract classes))
  • TypeInfoT (Stores run-time type information (template class))
  • Vector (The class Vector provides functionally equivalent to a ColumnVector object)
  • VectorBase (This is a pure virtual base class. The classes ColumnVector and RowVector are derived from this class)
  • WAMModel (Kinematics, dynamics, and other model functions of the Whole Arm Manipulator (WAM))
